data.title: Playlist length
data.solution:
N=int(input())
all_time=0
for i in range(N):
    string = input().split()
    time1=list(map(int,string[-2].split(':')))
    time2=list(map(int,string[-1].split(':')))
    all_time+=(time2[0]*3600+time2[1]*60+time2[2])-(time1[0]*3600+time1[1]*60+time1[2])
hours=all_time//3600
minutes=(all_time-hours*3600)//60
seconds=all_time%60
print((str(hours) if hours>9 else '0'+str(hours))+":"+(str(minutes) if minutes>9 else '0'+str(minutes))+":"+(str(seconds) if seconds>9 else '0'+str(seconds)))
data.statement: Alice asks you to help calculate the duration of her playlist. She has records from the history for each of the [[N]] songs, for [[Name]] the start time of listening is registered - [[time1]] and the end time - [[time2]]. Warning: Alice has a lot on her plate and didn't always listen to the songs in order.

data.constraints:
0<[[N]]<=100
[[Name]] may contain space characters.
[[time1]] and [[time2]] represent times of the same 24 hours day that starts at 00:00:00 and [[time1]] < [[time2]]
data.stubGenerator:
read N:int
loop N read String:string(1024)
write answer
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1>>: An integer [[N]] for the number of songs.
<<Line 2>>: [[N]] strings with [[Name]], [[time1]], [[time2]], separated by spaces. [[time1]] and [[time 2]], two times in the form HH:MM:SS.
data.outputDescription: A single line containing the duration of playlist in the form HH:MM:SS

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

Alice asks you to help calculate the duration of her playlist. She has records from the history for each of the N songs, for Name the start time of listening is registered - time1 and the end time - time2. Warning: Alice has a lot on her plate and didn't always listen to the songs in order.
Input
Line 1: An integer N for the number of songs.
Line 2: N strings with Name, time1, time2, separated by spaces. time1 and time 2, two times in the form HH:MM:SS.
Output
A single line containing the duration of playlist in the form HH:MM:SS
Constraints
0<N<=100
Name may contain space characters.
time1 and time2 represent times of the same 24 hours day that starts at 00:00:00 and time1 < time2
Example
Input
1
Yesturday 11:00:01 11:01:31
Output
00:01:30
